required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Opportunities and Limitations of Swiss Polytrauma Registry Data for Scientific Purposes- Registry Data for Scientific Purposes
clinical_study.official_title: Opportunities and Limitations of Swiss Polytrauma Registry Data for Scientific Purposes- Registry Data for Scientific Purposes

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the analysis is an evaluation of the current performance of the Swiss Trauma Registry (STR) with respect to providing a reliable basis for (scientific) investigations on the management of trauma patients in Switzerland. The current project tries to address this question by considering central aspects of completeness and by exemplifying the use of the registry for research questions. The aim is to identify potential shortcomings of the registry.

primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: The STR comprises patient data starting from preclinical management, resuscitation, hospitalization and discharge data as well as data considering 28-day mortality, long-term outcome and cost. The founders agreed on a total of 98 items for analyses. All data sets will be evaluated for completeness of the 98 data points (items).

primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: analysis of patient outcome: rate of patients' 28 day survival

primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: analysis of patient outcome: length of hospital stay (days)

primary_outcome.measure: rate of patients receiving intensive care treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: analysis of patient outcome: rate of patients receiving intensive care treatment

primary_outcome.measure: rate of patients returning to the previous living situation
primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: analysis of patient outcome: rate of patients returning to the previous living situation

secondary_outcome.measure: cost of maintenance of the register
secondary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
secondary_outcome.description: analysis of how many pro-rata salary per cent annually are specifically invested in the maintenance of the register

intervention.intervention_name: retrospective analysis of the Swiss Trauma Registry data
intervention.description: retrospective analysis of protectively documented registry data based on data completeness, patient outcomes, patient characteristics

study_pop.textblock: The data source for this project is the Swiss Trauma Registry with approx. 65 patients per year. Data will be extracted from the databank and transferred for analysis in anonymized form.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- documentation in the STR
- Injury Severity Score (ISS) â‰¥ 16
Exclusion Criteria:

overall_official.affiliation: Department Orthopedic and Trauma Surgery, University Hospital Basel
